qas.question: What are Jehovah witnesses best known for?
What do Jehovah Witnesses consider the name Jehovah vital for?
Why do Jehovah Witnesses reject inherent immortality of the soul, hellfire and Trinitarianism?

answers.text: they consider to be unscriptural doctrines

qas.question: Why don't Jehovah Witnesses celebrate the usual holidays and customs?

answers.text: they consider to have pagan origins

qas.question: What  in one of the Christian religions that observes Christmas?
What is one of the Christian religions that celebrates Easter?
What is one of the Christian religions which believes in Trinitarianism?
Which a Christian religion that allows blood transfusions?
What is a religion that doesn't limit social interactions with non-believers?

context: <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>Jehovah's Witnesses<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> are best known for <a0_0>their door-to-door preaching<a0_0/>, distributing literature such as The Watchtower and Awake!, and refusing <a1_0>military service and blood transfusions<a1_0/>. They consider use of the name Jehovah vital for <a2_0>proper worship<a2_0/>. They reject Trinitarianism, inherent immortality of the soul, and hellfire, which <a3_0>they consider to be unscriptural doctrines<a3_0/>. They do not observe Christmas, Easter, birthdays or other holidays and customs <a4_0>they consider to have pagan origins<a4_0/> incompatible with Christianity. Adherents commonly refer to their body of beliefs as "the truth" and consider themselves to be "in the truth". They consider secular society to be morally corrupt and under the influence of Satan, and most limit their social interaction with non-Witnesses. Congregational disciplinary actions include disfellowshipping, their term for formal expulsion and shunning. Baptized individuals who formally leave are considered disassociated and are also shunned. Disfellowshipped and disassociated individuals may eventually be reinstated if deemed repentant.
